ethnicity.description: In living in a country full of chaos, inefficiencies and conflicting ideas, Brazilians have developed a resilient mind and a way to carry on with their lives with humor and a good laugh in the face of adversity.

archetype.description:
Rio's violence creates almost a paranoid awareness of your surroundings, granting enhanced agility and defense reflexes.

The scorching heat of the city builds natural resistance to fire damage, while the lack of cold exposure makes you vulnerable to freezing temperatures.

experienceDescriptions.1: A fledgling Code Initiate, you have just begun your journey into the arcane arts of programming. You still need guidance in all but the simplest of rituals, but your potential is boundless.
experienceDescriptions.5: An Acolyte of the arcane arts of programming. You have the autonomy operate on others' rituals mostly unguided, but you still lack the ability to concoct your own. You excel best as a cog in the machine.
experienceDescriptions.10: A Code Adept with considerable power at your fingertips. You can craft sophisticated applications, solve problems creatively and guide the younger in their rituals. Your runes are a thing of beauty, but you still lack the ability to create impact at scale.
experienceDescriptions.15: An Archengineer whose mastery of the programming arts abounds and overflows. You can architect entire systems, lead teams of fellow casters, and your debugging prowess borders on divination. At this level you can masterly and effortlessly mimic, improve and create rituals of your own.
experienceDescriptions.20: You're truly a legend. You can not only create entire systems, but acquire the wisdom to know which systems to create and why. You command entire armies of casters and have the influence the very runes with which to write.

profession.name: Software Engineer

subclass.name: Full Stack
subclass.description:
Full Stack Software Engineers are the most versatile and well-rounded of all Software Engineers, knowledgeable in many of the different arcane arts of Software Development. 

However, their abilities fall short when it comes to design full-fledged complex systems operating at scale.

They're an excellent choice for small teams or teams that work on many different projects of lower complexity.
effects: Choose 1 skill proficiency between: Continuous Learning, Intuition and Effective Communication
For all these features, you can go up to level 3, if you haven't reached that level already: Backend Programming Language, Frontend Programming Language, SQL Fundamentals, Git, Cloud Platform.

profession.description:
Software Engineers bend reality by writing runes in a strange language over electrified rocks.

Their drink of choice for these long rituals is coffee, that has potentially dangerous effects on the uninitiated, but a fuel in the mouth of these conjurers. Their minds are forged by endless debugging and their bodies are hardened by prolonged sitting sessions.

This class gives little attention to armor and use little more than the most basic they can get away with. They generally wield Laptops as their weapon of choice, opting for Desktop PCs for bulkier builds. Inumerous builds are possible, leveraging a wide range of skills, from analytical, to creative and interpersonal.
effects: You gain Proficiency on Intelligence Saving Throws
You gain Proficiency in Light Armor
You gain Proficiency in Laptops and Desktop PCs
Choose 3 skill proficiencies between: Analytical Reasoning, Continuous Learning, Leadership, Attention to Detail, Artistic Expression and Strategic Planning.
Subclass: Choose at Level 3 - Frontend, Backend, Full Stack, DevOps, Mobile, Embedded Systems, OS Development, Game Development, ML/AI or Engineering Management

alignment.description: You have no firm convictions, you're skeptical of any strong ideologies, and wary of the classifications like good and evil. You're a pragmatist, balancing your deeds according to the circumstances.

faith.name: Atheism
faith.description: You don't believe in deities, afterlife or any supernatural forces.

ideals: The only thing better than writing code is deleting it
I don't deal in absolutes, everything is circumstantial
bonds: Spending time onboarding new people and helping juniors pays compounding interest
Code is to be written with empathy, it must make someone's life better
flaws: Sometimes I get lost in the details that are not so relevant to the problem at hand
The more I have to do, the more I'm likely to procrastinate

biography.lore: To me, writing code is not only a income source or a means to solve problems, but an exertion of my will to create, and to contemplate the beauty an idea in its most reduced form.
